com.sorcix.sirc

Class IrcConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sorcix.sirc.IrcConnection

  • public class IrcConnection
extends Object
    Main IRC Connection class in sIRC.

    sIRC acts as a layer between an IRC server and java applications. It provides an event-driven architecture to handle common IRC events.

    Author:
    Sorcix

    • Method Detail

      • addMessageListener

        public void addMessageListener(MessageListener listener)
        Adds a message listener to this IrcConnection.
        Parameters:
        listener - The message listener to add.

      • addModeListener

        public void addModeListener(ModeListener listener)
        Adds a mode listener to this IrcConnection. Note that adding mode listeners will cause sIRC to check every incoming mode change for supported modes. Modes can also be read by using ServerListener.onMode(IrcConnection, Channel, User, String) which can be a lot faster for reading modes.
        Parameters:
        listener - The mode listener to add.

      • addServerListener

        public void addServerListener(ServerListener listener)
        Adds a server listener to this IrcConnection.
        Parameters:
        listener - The server listener to add.

      • addService

        public void addService(SIRCService service)
        Add and load a service. IrcConnection will call the SIRCService.load(IrcConnection) method of this SIRCService after adding it to the service list.
        Parameters:
        service - The service to add.

      • askMotd

        public void askMotd()
        Sends the MOTD command to the server, which makes the server send us the Message of the Day. (Through ServerListener)
        Since:
        1.0.2
        See Also:
        ServerListener.onMotd(IrcConnection, String)

      • sendRaw

        public void sendRaw(String line)
        Send a raw command to the IRC server. Unrecognized responses are passed to the AdvancedListener's onUnknown() callback.

      • askNames

        protected void askNames(Channel channel)
        Asks the userlist for a certain channel.
        Parameters:
        channel - The channel to request the userlist for.

      • connect

        public void connect()
             throws UnknownHostException,
                    IOException,
                    NickNameException,
                    PasswordException
        Connect to the IRC server. You must set the server details and nickname before calling this method!
        Throws:
        UnknownHostException - When the domain name is invalid.
        IOException - When anything went wrong while connecting.
        NickNameException - If the given nickname is already in use or invalid.
        PasswordException - If the server password is incorrect.
        See Also:
        setServer(String, int), setNick(String)

      • connect

        public void connect(SSLContext sslctx)
             throws UnknownHostException,
                    IOException,
                    NickNameException,
                    PasswordException
        Connect to the IRC server. You must set the server details and nickname before calling this method!
        Throws:
        UnknownHostException - When the domain name is invalid.
        IOException - When anything went wrong while connecting.
        NickNameException - If the given nickname is already in use or invalid.
        PasswordException - If the server password is incorrect.
        See Also:
        setServer(String, int), setNick(String)

      • connect

        public void connect(SocketFactory sfact)
             throws UnknownHostException,
                    IOException,
                    NickNameException,
                    PasswordException
        Connect to the IRC server. You must set the server details and nickname before calling this method!
        Throws:
        UnknownHostException - When the domain name is invalid.
        IOException - When anything went wrong while connecting.
        NickNameException - If the given nickname is already in use or invalid.
        PasswordException - If the server password is incorrect.
        See Also:

      • connect

        public void connect(Socket sock)
             throws UnknownHostException,
                    IOException,
                    NickNameException,
                    PasswordException
        Connect to the IRC server. You must set the server details and nickname before calling this method!
        Throws:
        UnknownHostException - When the domain name is invalid.
        IOException - When anything went wrong while connecting.
        NickNameException - If the given nickname is already in use or invalid.
        PasswordException - If the server password is incorrect.
        Since:
        1.0.0
        See Also:
        setServer(String, int), setNick(String)

      • createChannel

        public Channel createChannel(String name)
        Creates a Channel object with given channel name. Note that this method does not actually create a channel on the IRC server, it just creates a Channel object linked to this IrcConnection. If the local user is in the channel this method will return a global channel object containing a user list.
        Parameters:
        name - The channel name, starting with #.
        Returns:
        A Channel object representing given channel.
        See Also:
        Channel.isGlobal()

      • createUser

        public User createUser(String nick)
        Creates a User object with given nickname. This will create a User object without any information about modes.
        Parameters:
        nick - The nickname.
        Returns:
        A User object representing given user.
        See Also:
        User.User(String, IrcConnection)

      • createUser

        public User createUser(String nick,
              String channel)
        Creates a User object with given nickname. This will attempt to retrieve a global User object for given Channel containing information about user modes. If it isn't possible to return a global User object, this method will return a new User.
        Parameters:
        nick - The nickname.
        channel - The channel this user is in.
        Returns:
        A User object representing given user.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Disconnects from the server. In the case a connection to the server is alive, this method will send the QUIT command and wait for the server to disconnect us.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect(String message)
        Disconnects from the server. In the case a connection to the server is alive, this method will send the QUIT command and wait for the server to disconnect us.
        Parameters:
        message - The QUIT message to use.

        protected void garbageCollection()
        Runs garbage collection.

        Gives the advanced listener used by this IrcConnection.
        Returns:
        The advanced listener, or null.

      • getChannels

        public Iterator<Channel> getChannels()
        Gives all channels we're currently in.
        Returns:
        All channels we're currently in.

      • getCharset

        public Charset getCharset()
        Returns the character set that is used for the connection's encoding. The default is the system default returned by Charset.defaultCharset().
        Returns:
        The character set for the connection's encoding.

      • getClient

        public User getClient()
        Returns the client used by this IrcConnection.
        Returns:
        User representing this client.

      • isBounceAllowed

        public boolean isBounceAllowed()
        Returns whether this connection is allowed to be redirected.
        Returns:
        true if redirection is allowed, false otherwise.

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Checks whether the client is still connected.
        Returns:
        True if the client is connected, false otherwise.

      • isUs

        public boolean isUs(User user)
        Checks if given User object represents us.
        Parameters:
        user - User to check
        Returns:
        True if given User represents us, false otherwise.

      • isUsingSSL

        public boolean isUsingSSL()
        Checks whether this connection is using SSL.
        Returns:
        True if this connection is using SSL, false otherwise.

      • removeService

        public void removeService(SIRCService service)
        Remove a service. IrcConnection will call the SIRCService.unload(IrcConnection) method of this SIRCService after removing it the service list.
        Parameters:
        service - The service to remove.

      • setAdvancedListener

        public void setAdvancedListener(AdvancedListener listener)
        Sets the advanced listener used in this IrcConnection.
        Parameters:
        listener - The advanced listener to use, or null.

      • setAway

        public void setAway(String reason)
        Marks you as away on the server. If any user sends a message to you while marked as away, the the server will send them a message back.
        Parameters:
        reason - The reason for being away.
        Since:
        1.0.2
        See Also:
        setNotAway()

      • setBounceAllowed

        public void setBounceAllowed(boolean bounceAllowed)
        Sets whether this connection is allowed to be redirected. If true , sIRC will change server when it receives a bounce reply.
        Parameters:
        bounceAllowed - true if redirection is allowed, false otherwise.

      • setCharset

        public void setCharset(Charset charset)
        Sets the character set to use for the connections's encoding. If a connection is already open, it will need to be closed then reopened before any encoding changes will take effect.
        Parameters:
        charset - The character set to use for the connection's encoding.

      • setConnected

        public void setConnected(boolean connected)
        Changes the connection state of the client.
        Parameters:
        connected - Whether we are still connected.

      • setMessageDelay

        public void setMessageDelay(int messageDelay)
        Sets the outgoing message delay in milliseconds. Note that sending a lot of messages in a short period of time might cause the server to disconnect you. The default is 1 message each 100ms.
        Parameters:
        messageDelay - The outgoing message delay in milliseconds.

      • setNick

        public void setNick(String nick)
        Changes the nickname of this client. While connected, this method will attempt to change the nickname on the server.
        Parameters:
        nick - New nickname.

      • setUsername

        public void setUsername(String username)

      • setUsername

        public void setUsername(String username,
               String realname)

      • setNotAway

        public void setNotAway()
        Removes the away mark.
        Since:
        1.0.2
        See Also:
        setAway(String)

      • setServer

        public void setServer(IrcServer server)
        Sets the server details to use while connecting.
        Parameters:
        server - The server to connect to.

      • setServer

        public void setServer(String address,
             int port)
        Sets the server details to use while connecting.
        Parameters:
        address - The address of the server.
        port - The port number to use.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • setServerAddress

        public void setServerAddress(String address)
        Sets the server address to use while connecting.
        Parameters:
        address - The address of the server.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • setServerPort

        public void setServerPort(int port)
        Sets the server address to use while connecting.
        Parameters:
        port - The port number to use.

      • setUsingSSL

        public void setUsingSSL(boolean usingSSL)
        Sets whether this connection should use SSL to connect. Note that the connection will fail if the server has no valid certificate. This property can only be changed while sIRC is not connected to an IRC server.
        Parameters:
        usingSSL - True to use SSL, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setServerPort(int)

      • setVersion

        public void setVersion(String version)
        Set the string returned on CTCP VERSION and FINGER commands.
        Parameters:
        version - The string to return on CTCP VERSION and FINGER commands, or null to use the default sIRC version string.
        Since:
        0.9.4
